name: Astero Nautilus (Elder Astero Nautilus)
description: The Astero Nautilus lurk amongst the asteroids of Pebble Beach. Their rock-like shells are hardened from centuries of consuming the minerals in the surrounding asteroids.

name: Modified Clipper (Modified Clipper (Zephyr))
description: Some captains have modified their Clippers so much that the hull seems ready to fall apart. Despite the constant need for repairs and maintenance, many believe the increased customization is worth it.

name: Saryd Trailblazer (Saryd Trailblazer (Pug))
description: The Trailblazer is the ancient warship Coalition shipyards are referring to during their sales pitch for the Sojourner. These relics of war are no longer in production. Of the few known to still exist, most are kept as display pieces in private collections. It is a rare sight to see one in actual use.

name: Corpse Trickster Body (Corpse Trickster Body B)
description: A dead Subsidurial. The head is missing, but the body has been infused with chemicals that keeps it somewhat functional.

name: Gray Eye (Gray Eyed)
description: Gray Eyes are very old Subsidurials that have developed thicker hides. They have also learned how to make a powerful slap with their tails. While they still retain the peaceful disposition of their younger siblings, Gray Eyes are often vindictive when attacked.

name: Plasma Parasite (Plasma Parasite (Large))
description: While these creatures are neither aggressive nor malicious, the Heliarchs consider them a nuisance. They are attracted to the exhaust emissions of starship engines and will swarm over a ship. Unfortunately 90% of their bodies consist of volatile plasma, causing them to explode violently when exposed to weapons fire.

name: Plasma Parasite (Plasma Parasite (Time Bomb 1))
description: While these creatures are neither aggressive nor malicious, the Heliarchs consider them a nuisance. They are attracted to the exhaust emissions of starship engines and will swarm over a ship. Unfortunately 90% of their bodies consist of volatile plasma, causing them to explode violently when exposed to weapons fire.

name: Plasma Parasite (Plasma Parasite (Time Bomb 2))
description: While these creatures are neither aggressive nor malicious, the Heliarchs consider them a nuisance. They are attracted to the exhaust emissions of starship engines and will swarm over a ship. Unfortunately 90% of their bodies consist of volatile plasma, causing them to explode violently when exposed to weapons fire.

name: Plasma Parasite (Plasma Parasite (Time Bomb 3))
description: While these creatures are neither aggressive nor malicious, the Heliarchs consider them a nuisance. They are attracted to the exhaust emissions of starship engines and will swarm over a ship. Unfortunately 90% of their bodies consist of volatile plasma, causing them to explode violently when exposed to weapons fire.

name: Unstable Wormhole (Unstable Wormhole (?))
description: These wormholes are too small for anything larger than a drone to fly through. The aperture is unstable and may shift locations, or collapse entirely, at any moment. The few drones that do make it through seem to have their programming scrambled, perhaps a result of the strange bolts of energy surrounding the phenomenon.

name: Marauder Hauler (Relentless Grudge)
description: Some Haulers are modified to reduce mass and drag by replacing the standard cargo container with something smaller. The previous owner of this Hauler took the standard Southbound Shipyards cargo container and cut it down to half its size.

name: Pirate Drone (Pirate Drone (ExplosiveSD))
description: Locals started making these in their backyard garages to satisfy a limited demand for unofficial combat drones. From a distance, it looks like someone duct taped an energy blaster to the side of a civilian science drone. Upon closer inspection, that assessment isn't too far off. Each drone has minor differences in construction materials and how the wires are routed. Few pirates actually use these, but the ones who do tend to buy them in bulk.

name: Pirate Drone (Pirate Drone (Explosive))
description: Locals started making these in their backyard garages to satisfy a limited demand for unofficial combat drones. From a distance, it looks like someone duct taped an energy blaster to the side of a civilian science drone. Upon closer inspection, that assessment isn't too far off. Each drone has minor differences in construction materials and how the wires are routed. Few pirates actually use these, but the ones who do tend to buy them in bulk.

name: Beacon Drone (Beacon Drone (ExplosiveSD))
description: Beacon Drones are designed to accommodate a powerful Spotlight for the purpose of drawing attention to hostile ships and other threats. They were specifically deployed to supplement security in the Paradise worlds, but Navy officers in frontier regions have expressed interest in adding them to their fleets. 	Drones do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a drone unless you have a ship in your fleet with a drone bay.

name: Liberator (Vindicator (Test))
description: The Liberator is a new warship that was originally designed by Southbound Shipyards to replace the Skein. Rumor has it that the project scope shifted focus during development when a ship of alien origin was discovered at the edges of the Rim. As a result, the planned fighter bays were scrapped in favor of the concentrated fire mount. This design crams all of the ship's gun ports into a single central location, allowing multiple smaller guns to emulate the effect of having a single larger one. This negatively impacts the ship's cooling efficiency and increases the amount of work maintenance crews have to put in for guns not mounted on the edge of the firing cluster.

name: Liberator (Liberator (Test))
description: The Liberator is a new warship that was originally designed by Southbound Shipyards to replace the Skein. Rumor has it that the project scope shifted focus during development when a ship of alien origin was discovered at the edges of the Rim. As a result, the planned fighter bays were scrapped in favor of the concentrated fire mount. This design crams all of the ship's gun ports into a single central location, allowing multiple smaller guns to emulate the effect of having a single larger one. This negatively impacts the ship's cooling efficiency and increases the amount of work maintenance crews have to put in for guns not mounted on the edge of the firing cluster.

name: Mega Freighter (Mega Freighter (Prototype))
description: The Syndicate's Mega Freighter is being marketed as a symbol for a new era of peace and prosperity in the post-war galaxy. Despite having double the cargo capacity of a Container Transport, the empty hull isn't much heavier unless it's carrying a full cargo load. In addition to the extra cargo space, this ship offers more flexibility for installing engines, weapons, and other outfits.

name: Sunracer (Modified Flivver)
description: The ship of choice for most professional racing pilots. With a focus on maximizing speed, a Sunracer lacks space to spare for ubiquitous things like cargo, bunks, weapons, or a hyperdrive. 	These ships serve a unique niche and are exclusively sold at inflated prices on the planet they're named after. Although it's possible to squeeze one into a fighter bay, the prohibitive cost and minimal combat capability means there isn't a compelling reason to use them in that capacity.

name: Liberator (Vindicator)
description: The Liberator is a new warship that was originally designed by Southbound Shipyards to replace the Skein. Rumor has it that the project scope shifted focus during development when a ship of alien origin was discovered at the edges of the Rim. As a result, the planned fighter bays were scrapped in favor of the concentrated fire mount. This design crams all of the ship's gun ports into a single central location, allowing multiple smaller guns to emulate the effect of having a single larger one. This negatively impacts the ship's cooling efficiency and increases the amount of work maintenance crews have to put in for guns not mounted on the edge of the firing cluster.

name: Marauder Behemoth (Marauder Behemoth (Weapons))
description: This Betelgeuse Shipyards Behemoth has had extensive modifications applied to its hull and cargo hold. Notable are the two fighter bays that leave no doubt that this former freighter is now a warship.

name: Marauder Behemoth (Marauder Behemoth (Engines))
description: This Betelgeuse Shipyards Behemoth has had extensive modifications applied to its hull and cargo hold. Notable are the two fighter bays that leave no doubt that this former freighter is now a warship.

name: Marauder Behemoth (Marauder Behemoth (Secret Prototype))
description: This Betelgeuse Shipyards Behemoth has had extensive modifications applied to its hull and cargo hold. Notable are the two fighter bays that leave no doubt that this former freighter is now a warship.

name: Marauder Carrier (Marauder Carrier (Weapons))
description: A captured Carrier under the control of pirates is unthinkable. It is more likely that this ship was reconstructed using parts salvaged from wreckage left behind during battles between the Republic and Free Worlds.

name: Marauder Cruiser (Marauder Cruiser (Weapons))
description: On extremely rare occasions, a Republic Cruiser will be captured by pirates. Rarer still are Cruisers held by pirates who have evaded the Navy long enough to make extensive modifications to the hull.

name: Marauder Hauler (Marauder Hauler B)
description: Some Haulers are modified to reduce mass and drag by replacing the standard cargo container with something smaller. The previous owner of this Hauler took the standard Southbound Shipyards cargo container and cut it down to half its size.

name: Marauder Hauler (Marauder Hauler C)
description: Some Haulers are modified to reduce mass and drag by replacing the standard cargo container with something smaller. The previous owner of this Hauler took the standard Southbound Shipyards cargo container and cut it down to half its size.

name: Marauder Hauler (Marauder Hauler (engines))
description: Some Haulers are modified to reduce mass and drag by replacing the standard cargo container with something smaller. The previous owner of this Hauler took the standard Southbound Shipyards cargo container and cut it down to half its size.

name: Marauder Hauler (Marauder Hauler (weapons))
description: Some Haulers are modified to reduce mass and drag by replacing the standard cargo container with something smaller. The previous owner of this Hauler took the standard Southbound Shipyards cargo container and cut it down to half its size.

name: Broadsword (Basket-hilt)
description: Long ago, a captain asked the head shipwright of Grendel Station to add an external fighter bay to the original Saber's hull. It didn't take long before the shipyard extended this modification with a second bay to create the Broadsword. This design is most commonly found in remote pirate systems on the outer rim.

name: Broadsword (Basket-hilt (CCOR))
description: Long ago, a captain asked the head shipwright of Grendel Station to add an external fighter bay to the original Saber's hull. It didn't take long before the shipyard extended this modification with a second bay to create the Broadsword. This design is most commonly found in remote pirate systems on the outer rim.

name: Broadsword (Basket-hilt b)
description: Long ago, a captain asked the head shipwright of Grendel Station to add an external fighter bay to the original Saber's hull. It didn't take long before the shipyard extended this modification with a second bay to create the Broadsword. This design is most commonly found in remote pirate systems on the outer rim.

name: Broadsword (Basket-hilt b (CCOR))
description: Long ago, a captain asked the head shipwright of Grendel Station to add an external fighter bay to the original Saber's hull. It didn't take long before the shipyard extended this modification with a second bay to create the Broadsword. This design is most commonly found in remote pirate systems on the outer rim.

name: Star Explorer (Star Explorer (Korath))
description: An ancient space exploration vessel from the early days of Hyperspace travel. Many claim the Star Explorer's design was heavily influenced by an old Earth science-fiction show as a marketing gimmick to entice young people to leave Sol and risk their lives exploring the vast unknown. Of the few that haven't been lost or destroyed, there are some still being used as actual science and exploration vessels. The rest are held in private collections by fans of antiquities.

name: Sunracer (Sunracer (Auto))
description: The ship of choice for most professional racing pilots. With a focus on maximizing speed, a Sunracer lacks space to spare for ubiquitous things like cargo, bunks, weapons, or a hyperdrive. 	These ships serve a unique niche and are exclusively sold at inflated prices on the planet they're named after. Although it's possible to squeeze one into a fighter bay, the prohibitive cost and minimal combat capability means there isn't a compelling reason to use them in that capacity.

name: Midnight Hauler VI (Hauler VI (prototype))
description: After a series of delays due to unfortunate events in the testing phase, the Hauler VI is finally available for purchase. There were rumors that an innovative new refrigerated storage system was being developed for it. But no such system is present in the final production model.

name: Marauder Hauler (Marauder Hauler (used B))
description: Some Haulers are modified to reduce mass and drag by replacing the standard cargo container with something smaller. The previous owner of this Hauler took the standard Southbound Shipyards cargo container and cut it down to half its size.

name: Marauder Hauler (Marauder Hauler (used C))
description: Some Haulers are modified to reduce mass and drag by replacing the standard cargo container with something smaller. The previous owner of this Hauler took the standard Southbound Shipyards cargo container and cut it down to half its size.

name: Marauder Hauler (Marauder Hauler (used engines))
description: Some Haulers are modified to reduce mass and drag by replacing the standard cargo container with something smaller. The previous owner of this Hauler took the standard Southbound Shipyards cargo container and cut it down to half its size.

name: Marauder Hauler (Marauder Hauler (used weapons))
description: Some Haulers are modified to reduce mass and drag by replacing the standard cargo container with something smaller. The previous owner of this Hauler took the standard Southbound Shipyards cargo container and cut it down to half its size.

name: Far'itar (Far'itar B)
description: Dedicated cargo transports are no longer necessary among the Korath Exiles. Rather than being scrapped, these ships have been repurposed to serve as mobile prisons. Criminals convicted of serious crimes are given a choice between a quick death via a microbot nutrigel processor or a life long assignment working on a Far'itar mining vessel. Prisoners who fail to perform their duties are still eligible for being tossed into the nutrigel processor. 	Operating these vessels can be lucrative for its captains, but the Korath authorities require them to activate their self destruct in the event of a mutiny or other event that could result in a prisoner escape. Whether or not they have the fortitude to fulfill this duty is put to the test whenever they engage in a boarding battle.

name: Far'itar (Far'itar B (Jump))
description: Dedicated cargo transports are no longer necessary among the Korath Exiles. Rather than being scrapped, these ships have been repurposed to serve as mobile prisons. Criminals convicted of serious crimes are given a choice between a quick death via a microbot nutrigel processor or a life long assignment working on a Far'itar mining vessel. Prisoners who fail to perform their duties are still eligible for being tossed into the nutrigel processor. 	Operating these vessels can be lucrative for its captains, but the Korath authorities require them to activate their self destruct in the event of a mutiny or other event that could result in a prisoner escape. Whether or not they have the fortitude to fulfill this duty is put to the test whenever they engage in a boarding battle.

name: Far'itar (Far'itar B (Jump, Limited))
description: Dedicated cargo transports are no longer necessary among the Korath Exiles. Rather than being scrapped, these ships have been repurposed to serve as mobile prisons. Criminals convicted of serious crimes are given a choice between a quick death via a microbot nutrigel processor or a life long assignment working on a Far'itar mining vessel. Prisoners who fail to perform their duties are still eligible for being tossed into the nutrigel processor. 	Operating these vessels can be lucrative for its captains, but the Korath authorities require them to activate their self destruct in the event of a mutiny or other event that could result in a prisoner escape. Whether or not they have the fortitude to fulfill this duty is put to the test whenever they engage in a boarding battle.

name: Marauder Kestrel (Kestrel (Bloodwind))
description: Several years ago, while visiting a sweat lodge in search of spiritual renewal, Tarazed's chief ship designer fell into a trance and journeyed to a reality separate from our own. There he saw visions of a strange and elegant starship. Returning to his work with renewed purpose, he spent the next seven years making the Kestrel a reality.

name: Shrike (Shrike (Gravedigger))
description: The Shrike is a nimble gunship that is usually outfitted to provide long distance fire support. Remnant captains embarking on solo missions might opt for a more aggressive outfit selection instead.

name: Wren (Wren (Gravedigger))
description: Thanks to its cloaking technology, the Wren provides discreet transportation to remote Remnant research outposts. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Wren's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

name: Marauder Vanguard (Marauder Vanguard (Sheragi Counterfeit))
description: This Syndicate Shipyards Vanguard has been customized with additional armored plating as well as upgraded shielding to accommodate the latest experimental technologies.

name: Diamondback (Diamondback (Bounty))
description: Diamondbacks have been in use since explorers first settled the galactic rim. They've fought in various wars throughout the centuries and few survive to this day. Those that have are so extensively customized that no two are alike. Some southern legends claim the Diamondbacks were wrecked spacecraft created by extinct aliens and salvaged by early explorers such as Han Sizer. There is no evidence to support these claims and no reputable scholar takes them seriously.

name: Deep River Carrier (Deep River Carrier (Full))
description: This is a Deep River freighter that has had some of its cargo container mounts modified to carry drones.

name: Deep River Carrier (Deep River Carrier (Half))
description: This is a Deep River freighter that has had some of its cargo container mounts modified to carry drones.

name: Storm Seeker (Storm Seeker Reborn)
description: An old relic from a time when the Wanderers occupied what is now southern human space, the Storm Seeker is a security patrol ship with an array of information warfare technologies built directly into the hull.

name: Thunder Maker (Thunder Maker B)
description: An ancient Wanderer planetary defense system.

name: Thunder Maker (Thunder Maker C)
description: An ancient Wanderer planetary defense system.

name: Thunder Maker (Thunder Maker (Modern))
description: An ancient Wanderer planetary defense system.
